com.mumfrey.liteloader.api.manager

Class APIRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mumfrey.liteloader.api.manager.APIRegistry

  • public final class APIRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    This is where we register API classes during early startup before baking the registered list into an APIProvider instance
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      APIRegistry(LoaderEnvironment environment, LoaderProperties properties) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      APIProvider bake()
      Bakes all currently registered API classes to a new APIProvider containing the API instances.
      APIAdapter getAdapter()
      Gets the current APIAdapter instance
      APIProvider getProvider()
      Gets the current APIProvider instance
      java.lang.String[] getRegisteredAPIs()
      Get all currently registered API classes
      void registerAPI(java.lang.String apiClass)
      Register an API class, throws an exception if the API list has already been baked.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • bake

        public APIProvider bake()
                 throws InvalidAPIStateException
        Bakes all currently registered API classes to a new APIProvider containing the API instances.

        InvalidAPIStateException - if the API list was already baked

        Gets the current APIProvider instance
